dc:title: From Union Square to Rome Chapter 1 - Why Dorothy Day 1938, Chapter 1, pp. 1- 17. Considers the difficult task of reflecting on her life and recounting her path to conversion. Some markers along her way included praying the Psalms, reading Dostoyvsky's and Mauriac's novels, and seeing the love of the poor found among those who don't consciously accept Christ. Links her suffering with others to Christ's within His Mystical Body.
